channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: SWE to Hold Professional General Body Meeting December 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers for its final Professional General Body meeting of the semester with Pratt and Whitney!
item.author: Students

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy to Present Professor Meyer H. Birnboim Endowed Lecture in Optics
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This lecture will feature Dr. Julie Biteen, Janine Maddock Collegiate Professor of Chemistry and Biophysics at the University of Michigan, who will present “What Can Single-Particle Plasmonics and Super-Resolution Microscopy Tell Us About the Living World?” Light refreshments will be served from 3:30 p.m. to 4:00 p.m.
item.author: Community

item.title: Zvi Galil to Discuss Georgia Tech’s Revolutionary Online Program, Future of Online Learning in Higher Education in Joint CS, ECSE Colloquium
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This talk will describe the OMSCS program, how it came about, its first ten years, and what Georgia Tech has learned from the OMSCS experience, as well as discuss the speaker’s vision of the future of higher education with much a larger role for online learning.
item.author: Community

item.title: Bid on a One-of-a-Kind Model of the Original Chicago Ferris Wheel!
item.description: You can own a one-of-a-kind model of the original Chicago Ferris Wheel! The model can be viewed in the Folsom Library, and bidding ends on Monday, December 2 at 11:11am ET, with all proceeds to benefit the United Way. Please visit the United Way Silent Auction page for bidding rules, and to scan the QR code to place your bid. Bid high, bid often!
item.author: Community

item.title: Harteck Lecture in Physical Chemistry Slated for December 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Department of Chemistry’s seminar series continues with the Harteck Lecture in Physical Chemistry featuring Victor S. Batista, Professor of Chemistry at Yale University, who will speak about “Simulating Chemistry on Bosonic Quantum Devices.”
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Offering Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling December 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review Session Scheduled for December 4
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register for this virtual event to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D. as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: HR to Hold “Conducting Effective Stay Interviews” Professional Development Workshop
item.description:
Date: Thursday, December 12, 2024 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM - In the modern workplace, it’s not uncommon for employees to investigate other jobs and opportunities. As a leader at Rensselaer, are you “tuned in” to what motivates your staff, and do you play to their strengths? This workshop explores best practices in conducting “stay interviews” and provides program templates to assist in the creation of individual “stay plans.”
